page.title: 16Mr.S.Dean - Farmer aged 84
page.content: Except for three years in Canada, Mr. Dean has farmed land in this area for 70 years! He is now at{Rockford {Farm.} Before World War One, Stevie Dean attended{Bisterne School}and then{ {Ringwood National School.}In 1914, at 13, he left school and worked on a farm with shire horses and later in life he owned his own{Percheron.}He could plough an acre a day with a good horse but he had to{"move with the {times"}and brought tractors and he could then plough 15 acres a day. In{Ringwood Market}he sold eggs, potatoes and cattle. He has also kept sheep and done his own shearing. His wife, a local lady, helped with milk- ing. Nowadays he doesn't get up until 6 o'clock and has only a few animals. He spoke sadly of splendid farmland nearby now{excavated}for{gravel pits.}
